results.title: The Hunchback of Notre-Dame = Notre Dame de Paris
results.creator_credit: Jean Delannoy, Raymond Hakim, Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds, Allied Artists Pictures and Cocinor
results.brief_description: Anthony Quinn plays the deformed hunchbacked bell-ringer Quasimodo and Gina Lollobrigida stars as the beautiful gypsy dancing girl Esmeralda in this French/Italian adaptation of Victor Hugo’s all-time classic novel about friendship, love and loyalty. Lavish sets, costume and make-up, along with a cast of thousands, are used to create a historical epic in the style of such films as “The Ten commandments” and “Ben Hur”, but unfortunately does not quite succeed in the same way that these films did. The dialogue at times is perhaps overdone and the film comes across more as a theatrical presentation, lacking a sense of realism. However this is not to take away from Anthony Quinn and Gina Lollobrigida’s solid performances in their respective roles. Cast also includes Alaine Cuny, Jean Danet, Robert Hirsch, Danielle Dumont, Philippe Clay. NOTE: This film is partially dubbed.

results.title: The Human journey: the family
results.creator_credit: Bob Conroy, CTV News and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Examines the evolution of the family as a social unit and discusses the problems resulting from modern families becoming increasingly smaller and more isolated. Suggests communal living, restructured neighbourhoods, and extended families as methods for making family life emotionally more comfortable.

results.title: The Hottest show on earth
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Schon, Derek Lamb, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A humourous film on the subject of home insulation. Topics include: the origins of fossil fuels, how to optimise furnace efficiency, common areas of home heat loss, weather-stripping and insulation. Narrated by David Suzuki.

results.title: The Human face of Indonesia
results.creator_credit: John Darling, David Haythornthwaite, David Roberts, Rob McAuley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Consists of five programs that look at the lives of five very diverse people, each giving an insight into life in Indonesia today. Examines the trans-migration program, the plight of Java’s low income groups, the administrators of one of Indonesia’s poorest provinces and a Dalang man who is trying to keep alive his ancient Hindu religion where Islam is the official state religion.

results.title: The Human face [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: David Stewart, James Erskine and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Comedian John Cleese and actor/model Liz Hurley present this BBC television documentary series exploring the dimensions of the human face, including its creation, function, sexuality, communication, identity and perception. Also features appearances by Michael Palin, Pierce Brosnan, Joan Rivers, Candice Bergen and David Attenborough. The four parts to the series are ‘Face to Face’, ‘Here’s Looking at You!’, ‘Beauty’ and ‘Fame’.

results.title: The Huge Adventures of Trevor a Cat/Foxbat and the Mimi
results.creator_credit: John Skibinski, John Taylor and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: The hilarious story of a cat, whose hunting instincts are accidentally over-revived, plus the story of a flying fox which takes shelter in a cave, something he regrets when cave spirits attempt to capture him. Rated: G

results.title: The Human animal: a personal view of the human species. Part 2 (X)
results.creator_credit: Martin Weitz, Mike Beynon, Graham Booth and BBC
results.brief_description: Desmond Morris examines the ways in which human beings behave in terms of our “animal” instincts. The three episodes are: “The Biology of love” which is a scientific and biological approach to aspects of human love, courtship and sexuality. “The Immortal genes” examines human life from babyhood in terms of the Life Cycle. “Beyond survival” focuses on aspects of behaviour exhibited by human beings beyond those required for survival; in particular creativity and imagination. NB: Features full frontal nudity and specific scenes of sexual intercourse.

results.title: The Housewife
results.creator_credit: Cathy Bennett, Wolf Koenig, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A study, in film animation, of a day in the life of a housewife, described without words, with a minimum of detail but with a perception all the more pertinent because of the simplicity of presentation. The film makes no judgments. It simply states the case, but serves as an apt starting point for any discussion of the role of women and the value of their work. (Award: Hilversun.)

results.title: Philadelphia, here I come!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Donald McCann plays a young man Gar, bored with the monotony of his life in rural Ireland, who seeks adventure in the wider world by deciding to live with his aunt in Philadelphia. On the eve of his departure Gar reflects upon his past, on what might have been and upon his relationship with his emotionally distant father. His inner turmoil and rage are relayed via his alter ego (played by Des Cave) who gives a caustic running commentary about Gar’s shortcomings and those of his friends and family. A funny and bittersweet adaptation of the Brian Friel play of the same name, the narrative is a rumination upon identity, nationality, maturity and regret. Cast also includes: Siobhan McKenna and Eamon A. Kelly.

results.title: What do you think about getting what you're after
results.creator_credit: Gundrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “What Do You Think”.
This film invites discussion of whether, in business competition, one’s standards of fair play should be lowered. The question revolves around two young women who seek the same job. While one has already applied for the position and is reasonably sure of getting it, she lessens her chances by telling the other that applications are still being accepted. A third woman questions the first’s “softness” and the audience is asked to judge. No. 6 in the series.
